para.text: A public corporation shall, and any other corporation may, appoint one or more inspectors to act at a meeting of shareholders and make a written report of the inspectors’ determinations. Each inspector shall take and sign an oath faithfully to execute the duties of inspector with strict impartiality and according to the best of the inspector’s ability.
Ascertain the number of shares outstanding and the voting power of each;
Determine the shares represented at a meeting;
Determine the validity of proxies and ballots;
An inspector may be an officer or employee of the corporation.
